trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The leopard has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the leopard moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a horns attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the leopard can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the undead yak to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the undead yak drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The undead yak makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its hooves.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Terrifying Bellow {@recharge 5}
entries: he undead yak emits a haunting bellow. Each creature of the undead yak's choice within 30 feet that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Rapid Retreat
entries: As a bonus action, the scout can command its war horse to disengage from combat without provoking opportunity attacks.

bonus.name: Mounted Assault
entries: Once per turn, if the scout moves at least 20 feet in a straight line toward a target, it gains advantage on its next ranged attack roll against that target.

bonus.name: Swift Shot
entries: If the scout uses its bonus action to disengage, it can make a ranged attack against a different target within its longbow's range without disadvantage.

bonus.name: Coordinated Assault
entries: If both scouts target the same creature with ranged attacks on the same turn, they gain a +2 bonus to their attack rolls against that creature.

monster.name: Yal'Kor Skeleton Archer
languages: Understands the language it knew in life but can't speak

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeleton archer makes two longbow attacks

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Yal'Kor Skeleton Guard
languages: Understands the language it knew in life but can't speak

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeleton guard makes two longsword attacks

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horn Attack Charge
entries: Once per short rest, the skeleton guard can make a horn attack charge. It moves up to its speed in a straight line and can make a gore attack against a target at the end of the charge. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Durak the Undying

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the ghost has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Incorporeal Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

legendaryHeader: The ghost can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. The ghost regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Ghostly Visage
entries: The ghost becomes {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Teleportation
entries: The ghost magically teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Gust of Wind
entries: The ghost creates a strong gust of wind in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from the ghost.

legendary.name: Spectral Grasp
entries: The ghost reaches out with spectral tendrils, targeting a creature within 30 feet. The target must make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet towards the ghost.

mythicHeader: Lair Actions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the ghost can take a lair action to create the following effects. The ghost can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

mythic.name: Spectral Howl
entries: The ghost emits a haunting howl, summoning a swirling mist in a 30-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature within the area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

mythic.name: Ethereal Step
entries: The ghost can immediately move up to their speed and pass through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

monster.name: Ghost Yak Stampede
languages: Understands Common and Yal'Kor but can't speak

trait.name: Ghostly Extension
entries: The ghost yaks are an extension of the Ghostly Nomad. As long as the Ghostly Nomad is alive, the ghost yaks cannot be killed. If reduced to 0 hit points, any further damage to the ghost yak is dealt to its owner.

action.name: Stampede
entries: The yak moves up to 60 feet in a straight line and passes through creatures. Each creature in its path must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 5 ({@damage 1d10}) bludgeoning damage and being knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half damage and not being knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

monster.name: Spectral Yak
languages: Understands the languages of its summoner but can't speak.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Charge
entries: If the spectral yak moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

monster.name: The Heavenly Yak-Suspended Behemoth

trait.name: Sentient Balloon
entries: The Heavenly Yak-Suspended Behemoth is a sentient creature with a wise and compassionate personality. It can communicate telepathically with any creature within 120 feet that understands Common.

trait.name: Moral Highground
entries: The Heavenly Yak-Suspended Behemoth always advocates for moral conduct and fairness. It encourages peaceful resolutions and disapproves of unnecessary violence.

trait.name: Airship Hull
entries: The Heavenly Yak-Suspended Behemoth possesses the durable construction of an airship, giving it resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

trait.name: Passivefist
entries: The Heavenly Yak-Suspended Behemoth primarily seeks to avoid combat, but it can defend itself if provoked. It takes no aggressive actions unless attacked first or its passengers are in immediate danger.

reaction.name: Reactive Defense
entries: When the Heavenly Yak-Suspended Behemoth is targeted by an attack, it can use its reaction to gain a +5 bonus to its AC against that attack.

action.name: Battering Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Air Gust {@recharge 5}
entries: The Heavenly Yak-Suspended Behemoth unleashes a powerful gust of air in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, a creature that fails the save is pushed back 20 feet and knocked {@condition prone}.

legendaryHeader: The Heavenly Yak-Suspended Behemoth can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only one legendary action at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. It regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Slam Attack
entries: The Heavenly Yak-Suspended Behemoth makes a Battering Slam attack.

legendary.name: Moral Lecture
entries: The Heavenly Yak-Suspended Behemoth lectures a creature it can see within 120 feet, forcing it to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition charmed} by the Heavenly Yak-Suspended Behemoth and cannot take aggressive actions for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

legendary.name: Lift Off (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Heavenly Yak-Suspended Behemoth rises 120 feet into the air and remains hovering until the start of its next turn. While hovering, it gains a +5 bonus to AC against melee attacks, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and its Air Gust attack's range increases to 120 feet
